questions.text: What kind of book did Frasier's friend write?
questions.explanation:
marriage.

	Frasier believed the man was a happily married man. He was in town to promote his new book on marriage and fidelity.

Lawrence Crandell.

	Lawrence was played by John McMartin. He originated the role of Oscar in the original Broadway musical "Sweet Charity" He later played the same role in the movie version.

questions.text: What was Frasier's friend's wife's name?
questions.explanation:
Valerie Crandell.

	Valerie was played by Joanna Barnes. Barnes was actually born in Boston (the city where "Cheers" takes place) on November 15, 1934.

questions.text: Who did Frasier's friend accuse of being attracted to him?
questions.explanation:
Rebecca.

	He asked Rebecca about her feelings and Rebecca got defensive. He took this hostility as a sign that she was attracted to him.

questions.text: What did Rebecca call Sam and Frasier?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Smarty pantses

	They asked her what happened next. She said, "I'll tell you Mr. Smarty pantses, he thanked me politely and left." Frasier and Sam thought Rebecca was very wrong about Dr. Crandell. They also believed she was very rude to him.

questions.text: How did Rebecca describe Frasier's friend?
questions.correct: lying hypocritical sleaze who needs to be neutered
options: lying male who should be shot
questions.explanation:
lying hypocritical sleaze who needs to be neutered.

	Rebecca said that Crandell was rubbing his foot on her leg. She even mentioned he had a hole in his sock. Frasier and Sam still didn't believe her however. They thought she was crazy.

Fabiana Udenio.

	Fabiana Udenio was born in Argentina but grew up in Italy. When she was 14 years old she became Miss Teen Italy.

questions.text: How many stupid things did Rebecca say Sam did before breakfast?
questions.explanation:
9.

	Rebecca wanted Sam to hide in the closet of Dr. Crandell's room so she could get Dr. Crandell to admit he came on to her. This way Sam would hear the confession. Sam told her it was a stupid idea.

questions.text: What did Frasier's friend say he was beginning to regret?
questions.explanation:
coming on to Rebecca.

	Sam had the door to the closet closed the first time because the chambermaid was also hiding in the closet and he was making out with her. Rebecca opened the door and made him repeat it at which point he said he regretted it.

questions.text: In the end, how many people were hiding in the closet when the man's wife came?
questions.explanation:
4.

	In the closet were the chambermaid, the fiddler, Sam and Rebecca. Rebecca started to go crazy because still no one believed her and Sam had to carry her out of Dr. Crandell's hotel room.
